the WebSphere 6.1 contains eclipse 3.1 as its OSGi framework. The BIRT need loads its own OSGi framework inside it.

CC'ing Simon since I'm pretty sure we address the same issue in the server-side work.

I think the issue here is they are using the EclipseStarter from the outside "container" of WAS which is Eclipse 3.1.  This is because the WebApp classloader is using parent first so it finds the class from the "outer" Equinox framework.  In order to launch multiple instances of Equinox in the same VM the Equinox framework must be loaded with separate classloaders for each instance.  In this case it looks like you are using the EclipseStarter class which started WAS to attempt to launch another instance of Equinox but it has already launched Equinox once so it fails the second time you try to launch Equinox.

The servlet bridge in the server-side work sets up a classloader for the framework that does not delegate to the parent for the framework classes.  This allows it to use a completely separate instance of the EclipseStarter class than the one from WAS to launch another instance of Equinox from the application.

Tom's on the mark here --

I think there are three areas that need to be addressed:

1) As mentioned, you need to use a child-first classloader to avoid accidentally loading the Eclipse 3.1 framework classes.

2) The System properties used to configure Eclipse 3.1 will conflict with your newly launched Equinox instance. Your instance should use "osgi.framework.useSystemProperties = false" and then directly set properties using "setInitialProperties" in EclipseStarter. In some cases you might have to null out existing properties that are inherited from WS 6.1.

3) osgi.parentClassLoader=fwk "might" still cause problems. We're better off to use "boot" or "ext" here and selectively expose those parts of the webapp needed.

--
The org.eclipse.equinox.servletbridge project in the main Eclipse depot has a FrameworkLauncher that comes very close to meeting your needs. It's probably worth taking a look to see if we can't tweak it to allow launching the BIRT Report Engine. I'm game for helping out here if there's interest.

This would be a great thing to add on the Wiki or server website around getting started or running Equinox in a container.  If the container happens to be OSGi/Equinox based people may have these issues.  Are there ways of making this real easy?  Just flip a switch (or even autodetect?)

Excuse my naivete here, but I have some questions (embedded in your comments below), about your suggestions Simon.  

(In reply to comment #3)
> Tom's on the mark here --
> I think there are three areas that need to be addressed:
> 1) As mentioned, you need to use a child-first classloader to avoid
> accidentally loading the Eclipse 3.1 framework classes.

Can this be set during the deployment of the BIRT web viewer application in WAS?  I know the WAS deployment console allows for this, but I was not sure if this needed to be set somewhere else.

> 2) The System properties used to configure Eclipse 3.1 will conflict with your
> newly launched Equinox instance. Your instance should use
> "osgi.framework.useSystemProperties = false" and then directly set properties
> using "setInitialProperties" in EclipseStarter. In some cases you might have to
> null out existing properties that are inherited from WS 6.1.

I noticed in the org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.osgi.OSGILauncher class in the 2.2M2 version of BIRT the osgi.framework.useSystemProperties has been set to false, and the setInitialProperties method of EclipseStarter is being used.
Do you know which properties need to be 'nulled out' from WAS 6.1?

> 3) osgi.parentClassLoader=fwk "might" still cause problems. We're better off to
> use "boot" or "ext" here and selectively expose those parts of the webapp
> needed.

It appears that osgi.parentClassLoader is still set to "fwk".  When you say it would be better off to use "boot" or "ext", is this true when using any app server to deploy the BIRT vieweer app that might include the osgi framework (ones other than WAS)?

If so, could you comment on why, and could a BIRT committer also comment on why it is currently set to "fwk"?

Also, I concur with Jeff, it would be extremely helpful if the code is not changed to allow this to at least have a wiki entry, or something that folks can change to allow for deployment in environments that launch the osgi framework.

Thanks for your help.

Susan
> --
> The org.eclipse.equinox.servletbridge project in the main Eclipse depot has a
> FrameworkLauncher that comes very close to meeting your needs. It's probably
> worth taking a look to see if we can't tweak it to allow launching the BIRT
> Report Engine. I'm game for helping out here if there's interest.

Hi Susan,

> Excuse my naivete here, but I have some questions (embedded in your comments
> below), about your suggestions Simon.  
-- no problem.

> > 1) As mentioned, you need to use a child-first classloader to avoid
> > accidentally loading the Eclipse 3.1 framework classes.
> Can this be set during the deployment of the BIRT web viewer application in
> WAS?  I know the WAS deployment console allows for this, but I was not sure if
> this needed to be set somewhere else.
WAS provides the ability to set child-first for the webapp class loader however in this case we're creating a URLClassloader to load resources from the jars in WEB-INF/platform/plugins. In other words we still are required to manually create a child-first classloader as WAS is unaware of the class loaders created inside the webapp.

> I noticed in the org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.osgi.OSGILauncher class in the
> 2.2M2 version of BIRT the osgi.framework.useSystemProperties has been set to
> false, and the setInitialProperties method of EclipseStarter is being used.
> Do you know which properties need to be 'nulled out' from WAS 6.1?
That's great. Off the top of my head the most important properties to either null out or set are:
osgi.bundles (null)
osgi.bundles.defaultStartLevel (null)
osgi.parentClassloader
osgi.contextClassLoaderParent
osgi.framework
osgi.instance.area
osgi.configuration.area
osgi.install.area

There might be others in the context of running BIRT however these are the ones I'd most worry about.

> It appears that osgi.parentClassLoader is still set to "fwk".  When you say it
> would be better off to use "boot" or "ext", is this true when using any app
> server to deploy the BIRT vieweer app that might include the osgi framework
> (ones other than WAS)?
> If so, could you comment on why, and could a BIRT committer also comment on why
> it is currently set to "fwk"?
First, this is not just a WAS thing (although the associated problems are particularly bad there). The problem with setting parentClassLoader to "fwk" is that your OSGi instance is no longer isolated.  The child-first classloader will apply to resources in org.eclipse.osgi however for all other resources the webapp classloader will be visible to every bundle. Some of the problems associated with this are version mismatches on package imports and unexpected results when working with singletons. On WAS you'll definitely have problems as for example the resources you think are loading from your org.eclipse.equinox.common in WEB-INF/platform/plugins are actually coming from the App Server.

The best way I've found in terms of integrating with OSGi is to use either "boot" or "ext" and then selectively expose resources from the webapp using framework extension bundles. In this way your resources from the webapp will participate properly in the bundle resolution process -- a good thing.

> Also, I concur with Jeff, it would be extremely helpful if the code is not
> changed to allow this to at least have a wiki entry, or something that folks
> can change to allow for deployment in environments that launch the osgi
> framework.
Yep. I agree and this is on the TODO list.

Thanks Simon.  I appreciate the explanation and will watch this bug for more info.

Regards,

Susan

One of the must thing to do while deploying BIRT in WAS 6.0.x is one has
to change the class loading scheme from Parent_First to Parent_Last and
the WAR Classloader Policy to Application. This may be not possible in all
cases and mainly when the EAR also packages other applications along with
BIRT, which may report weired errors while changing this scheme.

Well, the main reason to change the class loading scheme is WAS (infact
any application server, I guess) do not support loading of the same
classes (mozilla rhino js.jar) with different versions.

But while moving to WAS 6.1 would this madatory changing of class loading scheme be avoided, as the core for WAS 6.1 is OSGi runtime, which supports loading
of the same classes with different versions.

Thanks,
Ravi Chamarthy.
*** Bug 160311 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 157199 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

1. create an framework fragment org.eclipse.birt.api which exports all the BIRT APIs 
2. set osgi.framework.extension to that fragment
3. set the parent classloader to ext.

Now the BIRT can run under WAS 6.1

It is the different case for js.jar. As the JS.jar is part of the BIRT APIs, it can't be included into the OSGi plugins. So the problem is can a J2EE server to load different version JARs for different web applications.

We need add a new enhancement to remove the third party JARs from the BIRT API.

IMPORTANT: WAS Version 6.0.x!

We have exactly this problem in our WAS 6.0.x runtime, we are not able to 
change the Classloading policy, because of some other apps and dependencies 
in our EAR.

Our solution:
We renamed the js.jar and the icu-jar in the WASruntime\lib to .bak, so that 
this are not loaded from WAS, only the version which comes with BIRT are 
loaded in the deployed EAR file.

Config Summary:
Classloading Policy: left Default (Parent_first, Module)
Libs:.../IBM/Rational/SDP/6.0/runtimes/base_v6/lib:
removed jars:
icu4j_3_2.jar
js.jar

EAR:
packed all the libs coming with BIRT

This config works fine, it seems, that WAS 6.0.x does not need js and icu 
for its own :-)

To use the 2.1.1 in the WAS6.1, please patch the 2.1.1 as following:
1. download the the org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.osgi.OSGiLauncher from the main branch, replace the classes in the coreapi.jar.
2. download patches, replace the config.ini in the /configuration/config.ini.
3. add the org.eclipse.birt.api_1.0.0.jar into the /plugin folder.

Created an attachment (id=58231)
config.ini

Created an attachment (id=58232)
org.eclipse.birt.api.jar
Reopen this bug to backport to 2.1.3

(In reply to comment #14)
> To use the 2.1.1 in the WAS6.1, please patch the 2.1.1 as following:
> 1. download the the org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.osgi.OSGiLauncher from the
> main branch, replace the classes in the coreapi.jar.
> 2. download patches, replace the config.ini in the /configuration/config.ini.
> 3. add the org.eclipse.birt.api_1.0.0.jar into the /plugin folder.

Thanks for putting these instructions here.  I'd like to verify if what I have done to apply this patch is correct, and to explain one problem I had running the patched version of 2.1.1 with WAS 6.1.  Based on the above instructions, this is what I did:

From my version BIRT_2_1_1_Release_20060927 workspace,
Checked out the following files, using the methodology shown below:

org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.osgi.OSGILauncher.java
org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.PlatformConfig.java
org.eclipse.birt.core.framework.IPlatformConfig.java

Team > Switch to another branch or version > Select the tag from the following list > selected HEAD

Rebuilt coreapi.jar using the BuildCore.xml file

Put the coreapi.jar here:
C:\projects\BIRT\downloads\birt-runtime-2_1_1\ReportEngine\lib

config.ini here:
C:\projects\BIRT\downloads\birt-runtime-2_1_1\ReportEngine\configuration

Then I put the org.eclipse.birt.api_1.0.0.jar into:
C:\projects\BIRT\downloads\birt-runtime-2_1_1\ReportEngine\plugins

I can now view a vanilla report in WAS 6.1 - Yippee!

I can preview a report that has a chart in it using my runtime Eclipse workbench (launched from the project where I just added the above files)
and see the chart successfully.

However, when I try to view the same report with a chart in it in WAS, I get 
this error message in the BIRT log file.

C:\projects\BIRT\WAS6.1\WebSphere\AppServer\profiles\AppSrv01\installedApps\eliza2Node03Cell\birtEARFeb.ear\birt.war\chart.rptdesign
Feb 5, 2007 1:03:16 PM org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.ReportEngineHelper
SEVERE: invalid design file 

Can you tell me if a) I applied the patch correctly - it seems so, since at least I can view reports, and b) have you tested the patch when generating charts with WAS 6.1?

Thanks,

Susan

fix the bug in 2.1.3. 

Susan Cline,
I have tested the patch it works in the 2.1.2. Perhaps the chart design contains the wrong version (the design must be created using BIRT before 2.1.2).

Hi Wei,

Thanks for the comment.  I'm a little bit confused.  I believe I created the design and the chart using 2.1.1 and it did not appear in WAS 6.1.  I'll recreate a report design including a chart using 2.1.1 and test again and let you know the results.

Thanks,

Susan

(In reply to comment #21)
Hi Sunil,

Odd .. I thought I commented on this bug yesterday, but I don't see my comments today.

Anyway, it appears from the stack trace that you are using the IBM J9 JVM.  This jvm is not suitable for the J2EE platform.  Can you try running WAS with a JDK or JRE 1.4 or higher?

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org.eclipse.birt.core.data.DataTypeUtil (initialization failure)
        at java.lang.J9VMInternals.initialize(J9VMInternals.java:123)


Also, the CLASSLOADER needs to be set to PARENT_LAST for both the enterprise application and the Web module.

Did you look at some of the hints in the deployment section on the BIRT wiki?

http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/BIRT/FAQ/Deployment#Q:_How_do_I_install_BIRT_in_WebSphere.3F

Please let me know how it goes.

Thanks,

Susan

But now, the Class.forName doesn't work (with WAS61, Tomcat  and I suppose it's the same with JBOSS).

So, is the new OSGILauncher the final fix, and we have to load external classes in an another way (with parent ClassLoader or an another suggested method) or is this a side effect that you're gonna resolved ?
reopen this bug to address the issue in comment #25.

If the user's plug-in needs use the classes which doesn't exist in the OSGi framework, such as javax packages, the user must use the system fragment to import those packages into the OSGi framework.

To do so, the user needs:
1. create a system fragment to include the imported packages. You can use the org.eclipse.birt.api plugin as example.
2. copy the fragment into the /plugin folder.
3. add the fragment in the configuration/config.ini, as:
osgi.framework.extensions=org.eclipse.birt.api,user-defined-fragmment.

you can reference the servlet bridge to see how to use the plug-in in server side.

BIRT should add the servlet package to the system fragment it contains as the javax package is used by an BIRT API.

The system fragment is only used by BIRT in web application, so it is safe to always use the classes in the J2EE container.

Fixed.

Added packages under javax to system fragment in Runtime package.
In case anyone cares, I've checked the latest stable build of 2.1.3 in WAS 6.1 and it appears to work fine.  Now all we need is a release date :-)
Is this fix also in 2.2 or is 2.1.3 a separate branch?

(In reply to comment #31)
> Is this fix also in 2.2 or is 2.1.3 a separate branch?
> 

It is in 2.2 as well.  2.1.3 is a separate branch, but fixes are ported to 2.2.
